ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to use the IPaletteProvider inteface to colour lines and points individually. Using this interface you can colour a line, Column, Ohlc or Candlestick chart depending on a point value - useful for showing thresholds or areas of interest!
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to use the [url='http://support.scichart.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/17187/28/change-series-colour-dynamically-paletteprovider']PaletteProvider API[/url] to color lines and points individually. Using this API you can color individual data points of the following RenderableSeries:
- FastLineRenderableSeries - FastMountainRenderableSeries - FastBubbleRenderableSeries - FastCandlestickRenderableSeries - FastOhlcRenderableSeries - FastImpulseRenderableSeries - FastColumnRenderableSeries - XyScatterRenderableSeries
This is achieved by creating a class which implements [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PaletteProviders.IStrokePaletteProvider.html']IStrokePaletteProvider[/url] (for line series / outlines), [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PaletteProviders.IFillPaletteProvider.html']IFillPaletteProvider[/url] (for fills) and/or [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v4.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.PaletteProviders.IPointMarkerPaletteProvider.html']IPointMarkerPaletteProvider[/url] for point-markers. A single class can implement more than one interface in order to provide coloring / paletting to different series types.
[b][i]Tip![/i][/b]
The PaletteProvider is useful for showing thresholds or areas of interest!
